thread.title: Smugshot: Readers' travel photos of the week
thread.title_full: Smugshot: Readers' travel photos of the week

title: Smugshot: Readers' travel photos of the week
persons: Christine Rison Nikki Gosden Kathy Greensides Simon Cawley Andrew Drain Jennifer Morgan Alice Fong Lucy Kent Paul Copeland
text:
Smugshot: Readers' travel photos of the week Last updated 05:00, July 3 2015 Christine Rison Nikki Gosden Kathy Greensides Simon Cawley Andrew Drain Jennifer Morgan Alice Fong Lucy Kent Paul Copeland 
We went to Canada to see the Rockies. This photo is of my wife, Marie, taken at Bow Lake, halfway between Banff and Jasper. During our stay in Canada, this weather was fairly standard - clear, crisp days, with no clouds or wind. The Rockies themselves just go on and on. Turn another corner, another snow-capped mountain range. Amazing. 
While on holiday in the Yucatan region in Mexico, my husband Ray never wasted an opportunity to have fun. In overwhelming heat and humidity, he brings action to a pillar at Chichen Itza - the most famous and amazing Mayan site. 
I took this photo of myself in San Pedro de Atacama in Northern Chile. The area is called Valle De La Luna, which translates to Valley of the Moon. The photo was taken shortly before the sunset of the full moon. 
I spotted these colourful umbrellas while shopping at the Temple Street night market in Hong Kong. 
We took a desert safari out into the dunes an hour outside of Dubai in a 4WD with partially deflated tyres. This photo is of fellow tourists as we paused to watch the sunset, which featured a rich golden glow from the desert dust particles. 
This image shows the view from the summit of Mt Rinjani, Lombok, Indonesia. The 3700m summit was reached at 6am after a day and a half of climbing. The view shows not only the beautiful volcanic crater and ridge line but also the incredible steepness of the mountain. The ocean view in the distance shows how quickly 3700m vertical can rise from sea level. The small colored dots on the ridge below are the tents we slept in briefly and the specks on the ridge line are fellow hikers slowly finishing their ascent. 
My husband drives the canal boat as we traverse the Pontcysyllte Aqueduct in Wales. The aqueduct is 38 metres above the ground, and over 200 years old. It was a great experience. 
I spotted this shop assistant having a quiet moment checking her mobile in Hoi Ann, Vietnam. The green lanterns, yellow wall and the window frame all formed a perfect picture. 
My friend took this photo of me whilst I was walking through a small village in Senga Bay, Malawi. 
This view is from a beach bar near Estepona, Spain, looking out over the beach and sea to the mountains of north Africa. 1 of 10 
This week's travel photo entries take us from the Canadian Rockies to a sunset in Spain. 
Do you have a holiday snap that you'd like to share with the world? 
Send it to us and be in to win a Panasonic camera! Just click on the green button to enter.
